DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5 to 35 Unit Celsius (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Target Temperature
      Range 10 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Humidity
      Range 20 to 80 Unit % (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Temperature
        Range 10 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: Mode
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Set Humidity Target [SET_HUM]
      Parameter 1: Humidity
        Range 20 to 80 Unit % (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Current Temperature [REPORT_TEMP]
    Report Humidity [REPORT_HUM]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to 22.5 degrees Celsius in heat mode and set the fan speed to high?

To fulfill your request, I first identify the commands needed based on the device structure. You want to set the target temperature to 22.5 °C, switch the mode to Heat, and set the fan speed to High.

The commands are:
- Set Target Temperature [SET_TEMP] with parameter 22.5 °C (within the allowed 10-30 °C range).
- Set Mode [SET_MODE] with parameter Heat (enum value 1).
- Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN] with parameter High (enum value 3).

All parameters are valid and within specified ranges.

Result: Execute SET_TEMP(22.5), SET_MODE(Heat), and SET_FAN(High) to configure the thermostat as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Smart Sprinkler
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit liters_per_minute (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
    Next Scheduled Time
      String (ISO 8601 datetime)
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Flow Rate [SET_FLOW]
      Parameter 1: Flow Rate
        Range 0.5 to 15 Unit liters_per_minute (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCH]
    Disable Schedule [DISABLE_SCH]
    Set Schedule Time [SET_SCH_TIME]
      Parameter 1: Time
        String (ISO 8601 datetime)
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [REPORT_STATUS]
    Report Flow Rate [REPORT_FLOW]

USER QUERY:
I want to schedule the sprinkler to turn on at 6 AM tomorrow and set the water flow rate to 10 liters per minute. Also, enable the schedule.

First, I analyze the commands needed to meet your request. You want to:
1. Set the schedule time to 6 AM tomorrow.
2. Set the water flow rate to 10 liters per minute.
3. Enable the schedule.

The device accepts:
- Set Schedule Time [SET_SCH_TIME] with a datetime string parameter.
- Set Flow Rate [SET_FLOW] with a flow rate parameter between 0.5 and 15 liters per minute.
- Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCH] with no parameters.

Assuming today is known, 6 AM tomorrow can be formatted as an ISO 8601 datetime string, e.g., "2024-06-02T06:00:00".

The flow rate 10 L/min is within the allowed range.

Result: Execute SET_SCH_TIME("2024-06-02T06:00:00"), SET_FLOW(10), and ENABLE_SCH to schedule and configure the sprinkler as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bedroom Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Brightness
      Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Reachable
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]
    Set Brightness [SET_BRI]
      Parameter 1: Brightness
        Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Color Temperature [CLITEMP]
      Parameter 1: Color Temperature
        Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Hue [SET_HUE]
      Parameter 1: Hue
        Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Saturation [SET_SAT]
      Parameter 1: Saturation
        Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the bedroom light, set the brightness to 180 level, and adjust the color temperature to 3500 Kelvin.

Your request involves three actions: turning on the light, setting brightness, and adjusting color temperature.

From the device structure:
- To turn on the light, use the On command [DON].
- To set brightness, use Set Brightness [SET_BRI] with a parameter between 1 and 254. 180 is valid.
- To set color temperature, use Set Color Temperature [CLITEMP] with a parameter between 2000 and 6500 Kelvin. 3500 K is valid.

All parameters are within the specified ranges.

Result: Execute DON to turn on the light, SET_BRI(180) to set brightness, and CLITEMP(3500) to adjust the color temperature as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [REPORT_DOOR]
    Report Lock Status [REPORT_LOCK]
    Report Battery Level [REPORT_BATT]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door locked and what is the battery level? Also, please unlock the door if it is locked.

Your query has three parts: check if the garage door is locked, report battery level, and unlock the door if locked.

Step 1: Use Query Status [QUERY] or Report Lock Status [REPORT_LOCK] to determine the lock status.

Step 2: Use Report Battery Level [REPORT_BATT] to get the battery percentage.

Step 3: If the Lock Status property is Locked (value 1), send Unlock Door [UNLOCK] command.

Since the device structure shows Lock Status as an enum with Locked=1 and Unlocked=0, the assistant should first retrieve the lock status.

Result: Query lock status and battery level. If locked, send UNLOCK command to unlock the door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SET_SPEED]
      Parameter 1: Speed Level
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Enable Oscillation [OSC_ON]
    Disable Oscillation [OSC_OFF]
    Set Timer [SET_TIMER]
      Parameter 1: Timer
        Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [REPORT_STATUS]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the ceiling fan, set the speed to 3, enable oscillation, and set a timer for 45 minutes?

Your request includes turning on the fan, setting speed to 3, enabling oscillation, and setting a 45-minute timer.

From the device structure:
- Turn On command [ON] requires no parameters.
- Set Speed [SET_SPEED] accepts a speed level from 0 to 5; 3 is valid.
- Enable Oscillation [OSC_ON] requires no parameters.
- Set Timer [SET_TIMER] accepts a timer value from 0 to 120 minutes; 45 is valid.

All parameters are within allowed ranges.

Result: Execute ON to power on the fan, SET_SPEED(3) to set speed, OSC_ON to enable oscillation, and SET_TIMER(45) to set the timer as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Range 0 to 5000 Unit Watts (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Total Energy Consumed
      Range 0 to 10000 Unit kWh (step of 0.01 and precision of 2).
    Voltage
      Range 100 to 240 Unit Volts (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Current
      Range 0 to 30 Unit Amperes (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [RESET_ENERGY]
    Query Current Power [QUERY_POWER]
    Query Total Energy [QUERY_ENERGY]
    Query Voltage [QUERY_VOLTAGE]
    Query Current [QUERY_CURRENT]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Usage [REPORT_POWER]
    Report Energy Consumed [REPORT_ENERGY]
    Report Voltage [REPORT_VOLTAGE]
    Report Current [REPORT_CURRENT]

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and voltage? Also, reset the total energy consumed counter.

Your request involves three actions: report current power usage, report voltage, and reset the total energy consumed counter.

From the device structure:
- Query Current Power [QUERY_POWER] returns current power usage in Watts (0-5000 W).
- Query Voltage [QUERY_VOLTAGE] returns voltage in Volts (100-240 V).
- Reset Energy Counter [RESET_ENERGY] resets the total energy consumed.

All commands are supported.

Result: Execute QUERY_POWER to get current power usage, QUERY_VOLTAGE to get voltage, and RESET_ENERGY to reset the energy counter as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit % (0 = fully closed, 100 = fully open)
    Tilt Angle
      Range 0 to 180 Unit degrees (step of 1 and precision of 0)
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Shade [OPEN]
    Close Shade [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SET_POS]
      Parameter 1: Position
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt Angle [SET_TILT]
      Parameter 1: Angle
        Range 0 to 180 Unit degrees
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [REPORT_POS]
    Report Tilt Angle [REPORT_TILT]
    Report Battery Level [REPORT_BATT]

USER QUERY:
Please close the window shade halfway and set the tilt angle to 90 degrees.

You want to close the window shade halfway and set the tilt angle to 90 degrees.

From the device structure:
- Position ranges from 0% (fully closed) to 100% (fully open). Halfway closed means position 50%.
- Tilt Angle can be set from 0 to 180 degrees; 90 degrees is valid.

Commands to use:
- Set Position [SET_POS] with parameter 50%.
- Set Tilt Angle [SET_TILT] with parameter 90 degrees.

Result: Execute SET_POS(50) to close the shade halfway and SET_TILT(90) to set the tilt angle as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Air Quality Index
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [POWER_ON]
    Turn Off [POWER_OFF]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Reset Filter Life [RESET_FILTER]
    Query Air Quality [QUERY_AQI]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [REPORT_STATUS]
    Report Air Quality [REPORT_AQI]
    Report Filter Life [REPORT_FILTER]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the air purifier, set the fan speed to medium, and tell me the current air quality index.

Your request includes turning on the air purifier, setting fan speed to medium, and reporting the current air quality index.

From the device structure:
- Turn On command is POWER_ON.
- Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN] accepts Low, Medium, or High; Medium corresponds to enum value 2.
- Query Air Quality [QUERY_AQI] returns the Air Quality Index (0-500 AQI).

All commands and parameters are valid.

Result: Execute POWER_ON to turn on the purifier, SET_FAN(Medium) to set fan speed, and QUERY_AQI to get the current air quality index.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

        On [1]

USER QUERY:
Set the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius, turn on the ice maker, and tell me if the door is open or closed.

Your request involves setting the temperature, turning on the ice maker, and reporting the door status.

From the device structure:
- Set Temperature [SET_TEMP] accepts values from -5 to 10 °C; 4 °C is valid.
- Turn Ice Maker On [ICE_ON] requires no parameters.
- Door Status is an enum with Closed=0 and Open=1; to know the door status, use Report Door Status [REPORT_DOOR].

Result: Execute SET_TEMP(4) to set temperature, ICE_ON to turn on the ice maker, and REPORT_DOOR to check if the door is open or closed.

  ***Accept Commands***

USER QUERY:
Turn on the coffee maker, set the brew strength to strong, set a brew timer for 10 minutes, and start brewing.

Your request includes turning on the coffee maker, setting brew strength to strong, setting a 10-minute brew timer, and starting the brew.

From the device structure:
- Turn On command is POWER_ON.
- Set Brew Strength [SET_STRENGTH] accepts Mild, Regular, or Strong; Strong corresponds to enum value 3.
- Set Brew Timer [SET_TIMER] accepts 0 to 120 minutes; 10 is valid.
- Start Brew [START_BREW] requires no parameters.

All commands and parameters are valid.

Result: Execute POWER_ON to turn on the coffee maker, SET_STRENGTH(Strong) to set brew strength, SET_TIMER(10) to set the timer, and START_BREW to begin brewing.
